text: You have to manually create a table as well as every single column in the separate portal
Doing so will create room for more user error if you have an templates with specific columns names
We are working on creating some resources to help developers/marketplace providers protect their IP. Will be in touch soon about this

What's best practice for creating a new module locally before pushing up to HubSpot. I've duplicated an existing module but it means they both have the same ID if fields.json. Is there a better way to do this to generate a unique ID?
We have an undocumented CLI command `hs hubdb fetch` and `hs hubdb create` that works for simple cases where there are no foreign key relationships between tables.
You can use `hs create` in the CLI.
Hi James, check this out <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli#create> for more info
Field ids also only need to be unique within fields.json for a module and in most cases are optional.
Thanks guys! i just the hs create module command!

I ran into something interesting today. I have a `macros.css` file using theme values. When I went to push to another portal I kept getting validation errors on a ton of files. Then I noticed the `fields.json` file was blank in the portal. I uploaded that file individually and then I uploaded the entire project with no errors. Maybe during the upload process you can change the CLI to upload the `theme.json` and the `fields.json` files first? Seems like the order is what made things break for me
Which version of the CLI are you on?
